channel.title: Just installed linux (new user)
channel.description:
I like it very much from using the terminal, and the app list.
Does anyone have any apps they would recommend to me? I got xchat, NetBeans IDE, Java, blender. Thats it so far. Going to get wine soon.
But so far, I like it. Any comments?

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Music: MPD + Sonata

Do you want lightweight apps or are you not fussed?

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

no, actually from Sams Club in 2003.
I plan to build my own computer soon.
it runs fine, just that my GFX card is weak. Only has 128 MB of GD RAM.
T4, interesting sauce there, though I would not like a sauce recipe that came from a Wiki.

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:14, topic:281747”]KDE is awesome, just too heavy for my old 2003 hardware for the current moment.(What ever they did to Adept really screwed me over, I can’t figure out how to use it like I used to)

I didn’t have a good experience with NetBeans IDE, WEIRD things would happen with that thing for me(not sure why)[/quote]
My computer is a refurbished 2003 dell, with 1.5 gigs of ram and runs fast as hell/fine.

did you buy a wal-mart computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)

MPD?

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:281747”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=372197.msg2810703#msg2810703 date=1243974940]
For music: mpd
For video: vlc
For burning: brasero
For dvd production: deeveedee
For web browsing: firefox
For office: openoffice/ghost(pdf)
For music editing: audacity
For virtualization: virtualbox
For image viewing: mirage
For image editing: gimp
For ipod management: gtkpod
For irc: konversation/quassel/xchat/irssi
For torrent client: transmission/ktorrent/rtorrent

I think that covers day-to-day use…
[/quote]

I agree with everything here except I go amarok for music, and k3b for burning. I haven’t tried those apps you recommended though, but I will now to see how they are. :)[/quote]
Thanks, MPD is a daemon that can be controlled through terminal or a gui. It also can provide an organized database, icecast broadcast, and now playing info (for irc clients/etc).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

re-installed, never mess with loop0-2(mounting, etc), bad idea =/

brbgym, then, I shall download everything

–
installing updates is a pain

but I noticed no one listed NetBeans IDE or Python IDLE?

btw installed KDE - its awesome.

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:10, topic:281747”]GO KDE default apps!

I have used both, K3b is very handy, but brasero is good if you have an ISO and just want to burn it(not like trying to burn an ISO for some Wii game where you have to specify how many blocks per layer or what ever)[/quote]

I’ve burned many OS isos and also Wii isos with k3b with no problem, I’ve never had to specify anything special.

Read full topic

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)

For video: vlc

For dvd production: deeveedee
For web browsing: firefox
For office: openoffice/ghost(pdf)
For music editing: audacity
For virtualization: virtualbox

For ipod management: gtkpod
For irc: konversation/quassel/xchat/irssi
For torrent client: transmission/ktorrent/rtorrent

I think that covers day-to-day use…[/quote]

I agree with everything here except I go amarok for music, and k3b for burning. I haven’t tried those apps you recommended though, but I will now to see how they are.

item.title: Just installed linux (new user)
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I also recommend gtkpod if you have an iPod(which I use for USB storage anyway). ktorrent crashes for me at times I use transmission, but it is not as configurable. T4_ has a good list of selection.
the DVD production deeveedee is very stable, but you will want to save often. you can’t do things like you can with the professional sony software things, but it works well(though I wish you could make an animated menu)

Read full topic
